body.p: Here's instructions on how to use the Bluefin Maven Archetype to setup your project:

p.b:
If you haven't done so already, be sure to first setup the
Java and Eclipse build environment

body.p: A Maven Archetype , acts like a Wizard that steps you through the process of setting up a Java project. People create an archetype to bundle all the necessary setup into one command, so instead of having to create and modify all the files, the archetype does it for you.

There are two ways of using the Maven Archetype. The Eclipse Maven plugin (m2) allows you to step through the process within Eclipse, but it has been known to have issues. We recommend you try to use the Eclipse Maven plugin first, and if you experience problems, try the manual way via the command line. The command line requires that you install Maven .

section.name: Using the Maven Archetype via Eclipse
section.p: Start with the Eclipse New Project Wizard.

ul.li: Click File -> New -> Project..., and select Maven -> Maven Project, click Next.
Make sure the "Create a simple project (skip archetype selection) is deselected, leave all the other settings default, and click Next.
Make sure the "Catalog" option is "Nexus Indexer," and click the "Add Archetype..." button.

Enter in the following information:
Archetype Group Id: com.paypal.test.bluefin
Archetype Artifact Id: BluefinArchetype
Archetype Version: 0.5.0
Archetype Repository: http://nexus.paypal.com/nexus/content/groups/public-all/
Select the newly listed "BluefinArchetype" from the available list of archetypes, and click Next

Enter in your project specific information:
Group Id: com.paypal.test.<vertical> (where <vertical> is your vertical, i.e. risk, merchant, etc)
Artifact Id: (enter in the name of your project, maybe SendMoneyTests, or whatever you are working on)
Version: (you can leave the default or choose something else)
Package: com.paypal.test.<vertical> (where <vertical> is your vertical, i.e. risk, merchant, etc)

section.p: The Maven Archetype will now create your project for you, setting up all the specifics necessary to allow you to use the Jaws code and run your tests. The jawsConfig.xml file is not configured (you will need to configure the variables needed). If you have any problems, please try the command line as described in the next section.

section.name: Using the Maven Archetype via the command line
section.p: To use the command line, you must first download and install Maven . Once you have done so, open a command prompt, change directories to the directory you want your project created in (most likely your Eclipse workspace), and run:
It may download some things to get the environment setup, then begin to prompt you for your project specific information. Enter in the following for each prompt:

ul.li: groupId: com.paypal.test.<vertical> (where <vertical> is your vertical, i.e. risk, merchant, etc)
artifactId: (enter in the name of your project, maybe SendMoneyTests, or whatever you are working on)
version: (you can leave the default or choose something else)
package: com.paypal.test.<vertical> (where <vertical> is your vertical, i.e. risk, merchant, etc)

section.p: Confirm the properties for the configuration, and hit enter. The Maven Archetype will now create your project for you, setting up all the specifics necessary to allow you to use the Bluefin code and run your tests. This will create a project in c:\BluefinProjects\MyBluefinTests directory. Now go into the directory by typing cd c:\BluefinProjects\MyBluefinTests Now run the following command. mvn dependency:resolve The next step is importing this project into Eclipse:

ul.li: From within Eclipse, select File -> Import..., General -> Existing Projects into Workspace.
Click "Select root directory" and browse to find your project in the filesystem where you created it.
Select the project, and click OK.
Make sure the project is checked in the Projects panel, and click Finish.

section.p: Eclipse will now import the project, and you should see it appear in the Package Explorer. The jawsConfig.xml file is not configured (you will need to configure the variables needed).
